result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew S Regener was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

This sentence is concurrent with case #14CF167 Count #1, but consecutive to any sentences in being.

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay $175 in restitution to Fort Community Credit Union, joint and several with Georgette Swenson
--To pay $85.40 in restitution to Pick N Save, joint and several with Georgette Swenson

Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

--To pay costs of $268 
--To pay $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to submit to random drug or alcohol screens as deemed appropriate by the Agent 
--no direct or indirect contact with Georgette Swenson or Thomas Ruzicka
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency:  Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF69 and #14CF167 called at 10:07am. 
Defendant Andrew S Regener in court, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the Repeater enhancer from Count #2 in case #14CF69.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Count #2 in case #14CF69 and on Count #1 in case #14CF167; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Hall submits a victim restitution form that lists a zero-amount); the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Regener guilty of each count, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #4 & #7 of case #14CF69, and Counts #2 through #16 of case #14CF167.

In Case #14CF69 Count #2:  The Court sentences Mr. Regener to  2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is concurrent with case #14CF167 Count #1, but consecutive to any sentences in being.

In Case #14CF167 Count #1:  The Court sentences Mr. Regener to  2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is concurrent with case #14CF69 Count #2, but consecutive to any sentences in being.

The Court finds that Mr. Regener is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Regener is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

On both cases, the Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to submit to random drug or alcohol screens as deemed appropriate by the Agent 
--no direct or indirect contact with Georgette Swenson or Thomas Ruzicka
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--in Case #14CF69-Count #2, to pay $175 in restitution to Fort Community Credit Union, joint and several with Georgette Swenson
--in Case #14CF69-Count #2, to pay $85.40 in restitution to Pick N Save, joint and several with Georgette Swenson
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge on Case #14CF69 Count #2
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge on Case #14CF167 Count #1

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Contact prohibition warnings/penalties given. 
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 10:35am.
[Post-Hearing the Court instructs the clerk to mark the packet of documents submitted by the Defense for Sentencing purposes as Defendant's Exhibit #1.]

Returned by USPS with new forward address information: 411 S. Center Ave. Jefferson, WI 53549

cases #14CF69 & #14CF167 called at 8:56am. 
Defendant Andrew S Regener in court, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Regener waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

ADA Hall files the Information. Service of Information is admitted.  
The Court begins to recite the charge in Counts #1 through #15, however Attorney Zarwell indicates that there is an error regarding the charging language. 
After a brief discussion regarding the Party to A Crime designation, the Court adjourns the Arraignment to allow time for Attorney Zarwell to discuss the charges with Mr. Regener.

Case called at
Defendant Andrew S Regener in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atotrney Zarwell informs the Court that the State will be filing a new complaint and that may impact negotiations. Requests a Pretrial and a status.
ADA Hall informs the Court that the State will be filing a new complaint with 15 counts of bail jumping.
ADA Hall informs the Court that the Defndant has not signed his bond requests a seperate order for no contact  under 940.47 with the co-defendant.

Attorney Zarwell objects to the seperate order.

Court Orders under 940.47(4) the defendant have no communication with Georgette Swenson except through an attorney.

Court will sign an order
